results.definition: (of a clause) unable to stand alone syntactically as a complete sentence
examples: a subordinate (or dependent) clause functions as a noun or adjective or adverb within a sentence

results.definition: a word that is more specific than a given word

examples: Our wishes have to be subordinated to that of our ruler

results.definition: an assistant subject to the authority or control of another
rank or order as less important or consider of less value
examples: Art is sometimes subordinated to Science in these schools

results.definition: subject or submissive to authority or the control of another
